column5: I managed to fish Sunday, at Jacksons Point with a good friend of mine Shaun. We arrived at the hut by 7:30 am and set up are spreaders and starting jigging with our ice rods. The Jigs only had one touch all day. The tip ups with spreaders on the bottom had all the action. Shaun was 0/2 with about 4 other hits. I went 1/3 with about 7 other hits. The fish seemed pretty fussy today. We were fishing in about 55-60FOW. The guys beside us had a good day as well, it was great to get out again.  Here are a couple pictures from our day out on Sunday     Al with a 7lb Whitefish   Cheers Al www.alsadventures.ca
Nice Whitey. Nice to get out fer a change, eh?
Nice fish must have put up a hell of a fight
Good on Ya Spoon,    Nice Fish and good report!!!    Its GREAT to see the "younger"generation out there and having some"Fun"  Play Hard and Have FUN        Rick
Nice job!  That hut looked nice and comfy too.  Great pic and report!
good looking fish.   Can hardly wait for simcoe musky to start chowing down on those greasy buggers
Sweet fish, smoke them they taste awesome, gets rid of the oil.
Great report always nice to see pics from a successful outing.MTP
Beauty whitefish spoonman. Glad to hear a few fish were co-operating.
great job on the fishing.  what operators did u use...  dAVE
we used hank huts out of Sutton Ontario.  Cheers AL
